result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D. Silva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To be collected by DOC as a condition of extended supervision

records.addlTxt:
1:47 p.m. Defendant Scott D. Silva in court with attorney Lindsay L Erickson.  Defendant Scott D. Silva in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf221, 16cf123, 15cf185. Sowinski states agreement/Erickson concurs. Parties waive PSI requirement. State moves to dismiss 15cf185 - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read-in Count 2 in 16cf123 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement provided for Judge's review - will be e-filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. In 15cf221 - Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. In 16cf123 - Court finds that a factual basis for plea exists, accepts plea, defers entry of plea and accepts written agreement. Sowinski/Erickson/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Wisconsin State Prison - 3 - 1/2 CC to Winnebago County 
Initial Confinement - 18 months
Extended Supervision - 2 years
Jail credit - 84 days
Court costs - To be collected by DOC as condition of extended supervision. 
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. 
In 16cf123 Court reinstates previous $7500 signature bond - same non-monetary conditions. Review hearing scheduled for July 19, 2021 at 3:30 p.m.   
Adj. 2:22 p.m.

1:40 p.m. Defendant Scott D. Silva in court by telephone from Winnebago Count Jail, with attorney Lindsay L Erickson appearing in person. Mary Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF221, 16CF123, 15CF185. Sowinski statement--discovery has been provided to defense/information provided to Winnebago County. Erickson statement--speaks to possible consolidation. Erickson has materials from prior counsel. Court statement--if resolution reached, defendant would need to be transported. Bond continued. 1:48 p.m. adj.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
